facts: Royal Road enabled rapid communication across the empire.

rulers.name: Cyrus II (The Great)
rulers.description: Founder; united Iranian tribes; issued the Cyrus Cylinder.

rulers.name: Cambyses II
rulers.description: Conquered Egypt and expanded imperial frontiers.

rulers.name: Bardiya (Smerdis)
rulers.description: Contested ruler; authenticity debated in sources.

rulers.name: Darius I (The Great)
rulers.description: Administrative reforms; built Persepolis; standardized coinage.

rulers.name: Xerxes I
rulers.description: Greco-Persian Wars; monumental building in Persepolis.

rulers.name: Artaxerxes II (Mnemon)
rulers.description: Longest reigning Achaemenid king; diplomacy with Greek world.

rulers.name: Artaxerxes III (Ochus)
rulers.description: Reasserted control over Egypt; strong centralization.

rulers.name: Darius III
rulers.description: Defeated by Alexander the Great; end of the empire.
